title: InTransit
excerpt:
3Bridge Records is a label based in Brooklyn and their InTransit party held residency at TBA Brooklyn for a number of years. The label is always about forward thinking house and techno music and bringing a positive, welcoming energy to the events they throw. You'll hear melodic, groovy tunes that will make your night.

@shanstasticeric 
https://soundcloud.com/eric-shans https://www.facebook.com/djericshans @deepwoodsbk 
https://soundcloud.com/deep-woods/

title: Sonic Fusion Night
excerpt:
🎸 Wonderville Presents: Sonic Fusion Night! 🌌

Get ready for an electrifying evening of diverse musical experiences at Wonderville on March 9th, 2024. Our stage will be graced by an eclectic lineup that promises to transport you through the sonic realms of Psych/Math, Brooklyn Alt Rock, NJ Indie, Rock from the NJ/NY scene, and a unique blend of Kletztronica from New York.

🔮 Acts of the Night:

The Juice Is Okay (Psych/Math) 🌀
Embark on a mind-bending journey with The Juice Is Okay as they fuse intricate mathematical rhythms with psychedelic vibes. Prepare to have your senses stirred and your mind expanded.

Warpark (Brooklyn Alt Rock) 🏙️
Hailing from the vibrant streets of Brooklyn, Warpark brings an alternative rock experience that's both raw and refined. Their powerful soundscapes and soulful lyrics will leave you wanting more.

Melancholy Party (NJ Indie) 🌈
Join the indie spirit with Melancholy Party, a New Jersey gem known for their soulful melodies and introspective lyrics. Lose yourself in their atmospheric tunes and indie charm.

Soul Vacancy (NJ/NY Rock) 🎶
Let Soul Vacancy take you on a ride through the energetic landscapes of NJ/NY rock. Their dynamic performance and infectious rhythms will have you moving and grooving all night long.

Chaia (Kletztronica DJ, NY) 🎧
Bringing a fusion of klezmer and electronica, Chaia will be our sonic navigator for the night. Immerse yourself in the Kletztronica vibes as they mix traditional sounds with futuristic beats.

🌟 Date & Venue:

Date: March 9th, 2024
Venue: Wonderville
Mark your calendars, gather your friends, and join us for a night where genres collide, and music unites. Get ready to experience the magic of Sonic Fusion at Wonderville!

title: Hip Hop Haze: WEI, Owynn, & Houis
excerpt: Three electronic artists team up for a night of groovy, lush tunes featuring Houis, Owynn & WEI. Well versed in neo-soul & hip-hop, the lads will play original tunes that smack and pop alongside delicious piano and guitar licks. Wonderville's audience can expect warm vibes, fun personality and a slew of great music the whole time from these three excellent musicians. Houis

title: Agua Viva//Tiers La Familia//Holly Overton//Abbie from Mars
excerpt: It's Pi Night, so before the Ides, march into the insanity of this line-up! Showcasing the boundless creativity of a classic New York night with the mystical Agua Viva, the spendlor of Tiers La Familia, the dreams of Holly Overton, and the whimsy of Abbie from Mars! It's worth every dollar in any currency, surrounded by independent arcade games and bar/drinks of Brooklyn's Wonderville. Hot Dogs by @randwiches. Come

title: 2014 NEVER ENDED

title: Monthly 2 Hr GameJam Club
excerpt:
Please make sure to bring a laptop with a webcam!Make a game in 2 hours!Each month, we will make short games using simple to use game engines.This is great for beginners who want to make AND FINISH their first game!This is also great for experts who want to flex their skills and meet new people.1:00 PM Doors1:30 PM Workshop2:00 PM Game Jam Starts!4:00 PM Jam Ends, Presentations Start!5:00 PM The arcade opens for regular use.This event will be streamed online, so people across the world can participate.Snacks will be available.

This event is free to attend but donations are welcome and help pay for your

title: Saison Zero
excerpt: Saison Zero here! Again! Your friendly neighborhood Tabletop RPG Meetup is back. Designers, players, passerby's, come on down! Bring your dice! Bring your friends! Bring Nothing! Anyone and everyone with a open mind and imagination are welcome! There's going to be a lot to do (with a few surprises sprinkled in).

title: Tournament Tuesday: Animal Crossing & Nidhogg 2
excerpt: Celebrate Spring the Tournament Tuesday way! Bring your own Switch to show off your Animal Crossing: New Horizons island and let our audience members vote on their favorites! Hosts Ivy & Mel will conduct tours, award prizes, and do their best villager impressions! We'll round out the night with a Nidhogg 2 tournament, so stick around for both! #videogames #gaming #tournament #animalcrossing #nintendo

title: WordHack
excerpt:
WordHack is a monthly evening of performances and talks exploring the intersection of language and technology. Code poetry, digital literature, e-lit, language games, coders interested in the creative side, writers interested in new forms writing can take, all are welcome here.
Lineup to be announced!
We also have our OPEN PROJECTOR (like an open mic for digital work) where anyone can sign up to share a piece for 5 minutes at the start of the show. The open projector signup sheet will go out at 6:45 the day of the show.Host & Curator: TODD ANDERSONTickets - $15The event will be livestreamed at https://twitch.tv/wondervillenycJoin the WordHack Email ListGet a digital copy of the WordHack Anthology

title: === (EQUINOX)
excerpt:
Join us for a celebration of the Spring Equinox with LiveCode.NYC on March 23rd starting at 8pm! The Algorave will feature audio visual performances by local and guest artists. Bunny hop over to welcome the sun!

Performances By:

Saltzshaker
e-e-e-e
MDN
Sadnoise
Marzipan
Missy
Swan
mgs
surajbarthy
MrSynAckSter
haute.rod

About:

This show is put on by LiveCode.NYC, the live coding community of New York City. We are primarily a meetup group who gets together to discuss programming in real time. Sometimes we run events. This has ranged from workshops, to talks, to festivals, and some Algoraves. We run these events out of love for making cool things with

title: FOOL ME TWICE

title: The Pigeon Pack Presents: A Punk Island Benefit
excerpt: Another year of Punk Island? Another year for our Punk Island benefit shows!The Pigeon Pack is a DIY music collective in NY and we're excited to announce our first benefit show of the year to raise funds for the 16th year of Punk Island, NY's longest running DIY punk music fest! We're proud to announce that we'll be taking over Wonderville again to host our show featuring: Monica Bang, Funeral Doors, Foul Pride, Them Theys, and a DJ set by K8wave So come through to play some games, dance, and throw some $ in the tip bucket.Flyer art by @nopalita.designs21+, Doors 7:30pm, $15 suggested donation, no one turned away for lack of fundsMore Information for this year's Punk Island can be found at: 1) @punkislandnyc2)

title: Open VCR Night
excerpt: THE RULES:1. BYO VHS, or use one of ours2. Anyone may eject at any time3. If you eject, you must INSERT TAPETHE ANTICIPATED:90s Disney, workout videos, softcore, student films, local interest, choir recitals, insensitive cringe: anything may play. Anything may be ejected.Live commentary in the Twitch stream by FORT90.Live commentary in the room by you.ADDENDA:1. Fast-forwarding & rewinding is cautiously permitted, as is booing.2. Livestreamed to twitch.tv/wondervillenyc. Twitch chat is powerless.4. Ends

title: MEÆT SP★CE: VRC X IRL
excerpt: June 7th // Doors 8.00PM E // Show Starts 8.30PM  // FREEMEÆT SP★CE: VRC X IRL is a two-way event, existing in Twitch, VRChat, and Wonderville. Performers from both VRChat and Wonderville will be seen by both the online and in-person audience. Meanwhile, the audiences in VRChat and Wonderville will also be projected into each other's events. MEÆT SP★CE's acts have all been chosen based on grappling with themes of embodiment and feature postpunk lads, synths birth from Wonderville's community, internet friends meeting IRL, decks spinning on the Brooklyn stage, a drag king, cat girls, a billion silhouettes, internet DJs, and at least two wizards.Featuring IRL acts: No Jersey, Jay Ackley, SirCumSized, HEXE.EXE, radarwhiskers, and seriouslove.Featuring VRC acts: Dayrose & TehArbitter, KitsuneMixes, treesleeper.twitch.tv/wondervillenycVRC join off CalibanGreeneWonderville: 1186 Broadway Brooklyn NY 11221NO JERSEYJAY ACKLEYSIRCUMSIZEDHEXE.EXERADARWHISKERSSERIOUSLOVE

We also have our OPEN PROJECTOR (like an open mic for digital work) where anyone can sign up to share a piece for 5 minutes at the start of the show. The open projector signup sheet will go out at 6:45 the day of the show.Host & Curator: TODD ANDERSONTickets - $15The event will be livestreamed at https://twitch.tv/wondervillenycJoin the WordHack Email ListGet a digital copy of the WordHack Anthology

title: A NIGHT OF EAST COAST AMBIENT/NOISE IMMERSION
excerpt: 𝘈 𝘕𝘐𝘎𝘏𝘛 𝘖𝘍 𝘌𝘈𝘚𝘛 𝘊𝘖𝘈𝘚𝘛 𝘈𝘔𝘉𝘐𝘌𝘕𝘛/𝘕𝘖𝘐𝘚𝘌 𝘐𝘔𝘔𝘌𝘙𝘚𝘐𝘖𝘕:Join us for a night of melody and dissonance. Ranging from ambient drone to power electronics, you will experience a spectrum of emotion from experimental artists on the east coast.Lineup:Cementation Anxiety (Dark Ambient/Drone/Noise):Hailing from New Jersey's Hudson County, Cementation Anxiety draws influence from the last four decades of ambient, drone, and industrial music—all while channeling the urgency and ethereality of 80’s post-punk and dream-pop. This confluence of sound manifests itself in his dense, yet weightless atmospheres that envelop the listener. The juxtaposition of emotional extremes permeate Cementation Anxiety’s sound—challenging the listener’s position therein. Start with the EP 𝘓𝘪𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘢𝘭 𝘐𝘯𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘣𝘪𝘭𝘪𝘵𝘺 from Trust Collective.- Bandcamp-   InstagramSkin Prisoner (Ambient Power Electronics/Harsh Noise):Philadelphia's Skin Prisoner explores emotive extremes with his unique brand of emotional Power Electronics, echoing sentiments of Ramleh's 𝘏𝘰𝘭𝘦 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘏𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘵 and even Jerome's Dream's catalog. Try his album 𝘚𝘦𝘱𝘢𝘳𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯.- Bandcamp- Instagram: Masoller (Dark Ambient/Gloom Electronics/Noise)DAYMARE STATE GLOOM ELECTRONICS: From Wilkes-Barre, PA, Masoller's stark juxtaposition of dense, inundating atmospheres with bleak, dissonant passages of noise envelop the listener. His full-length 𝘓𝘦𝘴𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘘𝘶𝘢𝘳𝘳𝘺 on Cremation Lily's label Strange Rules underscores these sentiments.- Bandcamp- InstagramMorerose (Ambient Harsh Noise/Harsh Noise Wall/Musique Concrète/Electroacoustic):Trauma noise. From Ridgewood, Queens, Morerose's minimal and unrelenting style of harsh noise is patchworked with foreboding electroacoustic movements, cataloging both deeply personal and collective agonies. Fiercely determined to self-release her own work, her 2023 EP Fall Risk was composed almost entirely on an iOS app while in psychiatric inpatient. Her new EP𝘍𝘈𝘊𝘌 𝘏𝘖𝘓𝘌𝘚  is an unsettling interrogation of her lifelong struggle with dermatillomania. VERY MINOR GORE AND NOT MINOR STROBE WARNING.- Bandcamp  - InstagramInfrasubcontra (Ambient/Tuba Drone/Neoclassical):FREELY IMPROVISED, AMPLIFIED, LOW FREQUENCE METALWIND MUSICK: melodic, yet cacophonous, New Jersey's Infrasubcontra (Passaic County) bring a confluence of tuba-driven drone and noisy textures that compel the listener from start to finish. Check out their album 𝘚𝘶𝘯 𝘈𝘮𝘱𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘚𝘪𝘭𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘦𝘥 𝘏𝘰𝘳𝘯𝘴 to hear for yourself.- Bandcamp-

title: Parsons Design & Technology Pop-up Arcade
excerpt:
🎮 𝗻𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁 ✨
.
🕒— Feb 22nd (Thursday) from 7 pm - 10 pm
📍— @wondervillenyc 1186 Broadway, Brooklyn, NY 11221
⚠️— You have to be 21+

Positioning as work-in-progress, faculty and students at MFA and BFA DT have come together to demo and test their latest playful creations. Please join us to celebrate the work and share your honest feedback with us, tipsy.

We currently have a lineup of 18 big and small playful projects:
- Wiggy Wiggy (Julia Daser, Luca Jeha Civita, Terry Kahn)
- 996 Tech (Zhuoran Ma, Yue (Krystal) Huang, Yijia Guo)
- Arctic Balance (Yao Wu, Siyuan Fu)
- buccaneer buds/Hivemind (Lea Melendez)
- Sushi Paw (Yi Wang)
- FOOSCADE (Hong Hua)
- Collaborative Drawing Machine (Murat Barlas)
- Shadows of Hues (Akshita Jain)
- Museum of Remaking Hanzi (Ruohan Wang, Ziyi Wang, Xinyu Zhang, Jinyun Li)
- Cyber Angel Helpline (Hua Caparusso)
- Anger Management (Heeya Mody, Leo Dastur)
- Unsaid (Reshma Rose Thomas)
- Craft Collect (Shristi Singh)
- Mediamorphosis (Arden Schager)
- We are all ants/disco[ntrol] (Jonny Hopkins)
- Traveling Witch (Kyle Li)
- you are god (Ranger Liu)

Wonderville is the first all-independent arcade bar, featuring over 30 custom-built free-to-play games by members of the NYC games community. Many of the indie arcades that our proud alums designed or programmed or both are in the permanent display in the bar!!

See you there!
.
Poster by @marshall.obj @silllkie
.

title: Saison Zero
excerpt:
We’re still rockin. We’re still rollin. Your friendly neighborhood TTRPG Meetup is Back! 

Saison Zero is a monthly tabletop role play game meetup dedicated to introducing folks to games other than just D&D. Light on rules, rich in flavor. 

This month we're holding open tables for Troika! TROIKA! A little bit of everything and a lot of everything else. You and your cosmopolitan group of fellow travelers explore the ends of the multiverse. This Sci-fi RPG is designed to be wonderous to play and simple to run. NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY. 

This is a beginner friendly event. Rulebooks and other resources will be available. We encourage you to bring dice if you have them and something to write with, but we’ll have extras! Questions? Reach out to @theRealRickolas on IG or email saisonzeronyc@gmail.com. The event is free, and open to all with an open mind and imagination! #ttrpg #ttrpgdice #dice #rpgdice #troika

title: Monthly 2 Hr GameJam Club: RPG Maker
excerpt:
Please make sure to bring a laptop with a webcam!Make a game in 2 hours!Each month, we will make short games using simple to use game engines.This is great for beginners who want to make AND FINISH their first game!This is also great for experts who want to flex their skills and meet new people.1:00 PM Doors1:30 PM Workshop2:00 PM Game Jam Starts!4:00 PM Jam Ends, Presentations Start!5:00 PM The arcade opens for regular use.This event will be streamed online, so people across the world can participate.Snacks will be available.

This event is free to attend but donations are welcome and help pay for your
